```{r data generation, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
x = -4:4
n = length(x)
f = sample(10:(10+n-1),n)*sample(c(-1,1),n,T)
a = sample(1:4,1)*sample(c(-1,1),1)

fn = rev(f)
fna = fn[x==a]

nf = -f
nfa = nf[x==a]

```

Question
========

Function $f$ is defined by the table below:

```{r,echo=F,warning=F}
library(kableExtra)
df = data.frame(x,f)
colnames(df) = c("$x$","$f(x)$")
kable_styling(kable(df),bootstrap_options = "bordered",full_width = F)
```

Let $a=`r a`$. 

* Evaluate $-f(a)$.


Solution
========

* First, evaluate $f(`r a`)$.
$$f(`r a`)=`r f[x==a]`$$

* So, we can just multiply both sides of the equation by $-1$.
$$-f(`r a`) = `r nfa`$$

* Thus, $$-f(a)=`r nfa`$$
(because $a=`r a`$)
